text.p: Following are some of the main stories in Dutch newspapers today. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- European stock markets brace for a fall following two losing sessions on Wall St. before and after Easter break. (1)
- ING plans to integrate its ING Bank International and london-based ING Barings units. (1)
- Food group Nutricia to change name to Numico in bid to limit any damage to its brands caused by health scares. (1)
- Labour union asks Philips Electronics to clarify reports that company plans to shift vacuum cleaner production to Poland. (4)
- Study concludes that Dutch shares have outperformed emerging stock markets since 1992. (8)

- Home Affairs Minister Hans Dijkstal irked by Turkish criticism that Dutch not doing enough to protect Turkish immigrants. Criticism follows arson attack with possible racial motive in which six members of a Turkish family died. (1)
- Tense day expected on European stock exchanges after heavy fall for Wall Street before and after Easter break. (2)
- Amsterdam's Hotel Krasnapolsky flourishes again after extensive refurbishing. (2)
- Police in Den Bosch arrest 100 soccer fans in pre-emptive strike aimed at preventing violent clashes between fans of local soccer team and visiting fans from The Hague. (1)
- Leaking of confidential information thwarts investigation into illegal drug dealing by Dutch soldiers stationed in Seedorf, Germany. (1)
